definition: to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: Zhu Liya tracks investigation to also come to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 朱麗婭追蹤調查亦來到日本。

sentences.english: The fifth part has tracked and investigated the policy of the training vouchers.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分追蹤調查培訓券政策。

sentences.english: Intrepid reporters at the New York Post headed to a local movie theater for follow-up.
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的紐約郵報記者深入本地電影院追蹤調查。

sentences.english: American Community Survey, Questions and Answers, Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 中國健康與養老追蹤調查試調查。
